org.lightningj.paywall.springboot2.paymenthandler

Class DemoFullPaymentData

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.lightningj.paywall.springboot2.paymenthandler.DemoFullPaymentData
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FullPaymentData, MinimalPaymentData, PaymentData, PerRequestPaymentData, StandardPaymentData

    @Entity
public class DemoFullPaymentData
extends java.lang.Object
implements FullPaymentData
    Demo payment data implementing the FullPaymentData requirements for payment flow to work. It is a simple JPA Entity with columns for all fields defined for FullPaymentData.

        public Amount getOrderAmount()

      • getInvoiceAmount

        public CryptoAmount getInvoiceAmount()
        Specified by:
        getInvoiceAmount in interface StandardPaymentData
        Returns:
        the amount set in the lightning invoice, this is the same as orderAmount if the same currency is used in order as in lightning invoice, otherwise is the currency converted before creating the invoice in LightningHandler and the actual invoiced amount is specified here.

        Specified by:
        getInvoiceExpireDate in interface StandardPaymentData
        Returns:
        the date a generated invoice should expire, this value will be used when creating invoice in LightningHandler. If null will default invoice validity be used to calculate an expire date automatically.

        Specified by:
        getSettledAmount in interface StandardPaymentData
        Returns:
        the amount that was settled in the LightningHandlers supported crypto currency. Should be equal to invoiceAmount if fully settled. Null if invoice isn't settled yet.

      • getSettlementDuration

        public java.time.Duration getSettlementDuration()
        The settlement duration indicates how long time a generated settlement should be valid. If not set will a default settlement value be used. In FullPaymentData it is also possible to specifiy an expiration date of an settlement used if it's required to set a fixed time when the settlement should expire, for example if a settlement should be valid the entire day or month.

        If settlement expire date is set it has precedence over settlementDuration.

        Important: Data in this field is only set to instruct the settlement token generator of expiration date. the actual settlement date is not updated in this field.

        Specified by:
        getSettlementDuration in interface StandardPaymentData
        Returns:
        the duration the settlement should be valid, null if default settlement duration should be used or if a fixed expiration date should be used.
        See Also:
        FullPaymentData.getSettlementExpireDate()

      • setSettlementDuration

        public void setSettlementDuration(java.time.Duration settlementDuration)
        The settlement duration indicates how long time a generated settlement should be valid. If not set will a default settlement value be used. In FullPaymentData it is also possible to specifiy an expiration date of an settlement used if it's required to set a fixed time when the settlement should expire, for example if a settlement should be valid the entire day or month.

        If settlement expire date is set it has precedence over settlementDuration.

        Specified by:
        setSettlementDuration in interface StandardPaymentData
        Parameters:
        settlementDuration - the specific duration of this message.
        See Also:
        FullPaymentData.getSettlementExpireDate()

      • getSettlementExpireDate

        public java.time.Instant getSettlementExpireDate()
        Description copied from interface: FullPaymentData
        The settlement expire date sets the timestamp when a generated settlement token should expire. If not set will a settlementDuration be used, and if that is also null will default duration be set. This field is useful if a settlement should be valid the entire day or month.

        If settlement expire date is set it has precedence over settlementDuration.

        Important: Data in this field is only set to instruct the settlement token generator of expiration date. the actual settlement date is not updated in this field.

        Specified by:
        getSettlementExpireDate in interface FullPaymentData
        Returns:
        the date the settlement will expire used to indicate how long a settlement token should be valid. If null will default settlement validity be used.
        See Also:
        StandardPaymentData.getSettlementDuration()

      • setSettlementExpireDate

        public void setSettlementExpireDate(java.time.Instant settlementExpireDate)
        Description copied from interface: FullPaymentData
        The settlement expire date sets the timestamp when a generated settlement token should expire. If not set will a settlementDuration be used, and if that is also null will default duration be set. In FullPaymentData it is also possible This field is useful if a settlement should be valid the entire day or month.

        If settlement expire date is set it has precedence over settlementDuration.

        Important: Data in this field is only set to instruct the settlement token generator of expiration date. the actual settlement date is not updated in this field.

        Specified by:
        setSettlementExpireDate in interface FullPaymentData
        Parameters:
        settlementExpireDate - the date the settlement will expire used to indicate how long a settlement token should be valid. If null will default settlement validity be used.
        See Also:
        StandardPaymentData.getSettlementDuration()

      • isPayPerRequest

        public boolean isPayPerRequest()
        Specified by:
        isPayPerRequest in interface PerRequestPaymentData
        Returns:
        flag indicating that this payment is for one request only. The implementation can take the payPerRequest flag from the order request as guidance, but it is the PaymentHandler that ultimately decides if payPerRequest should be set.

      • setPayPerRequest

        public void setPayPerRequest(boolean payPerRequest)
        Specified by:
        setPayPerRequest in interface PerRequestPaymentData
        Parameters:
        payPerRequest - flag indicating that this payment is for one request only. The implementation can take the payPerRequest flag from the order request as guidance, but it is the PaymentHandler that ultimately decides if payPerRequest should be set.

      • isExecuted

        public boolean isExecuted()
        Specified by:
        isExecuted in interface PerRequestPaymentData
        Returns:
        true if related request have been executed, is set after successful processing if a payed call and used to indicate that it cannot be processed again.

      • setExecuted

        public void setExecuted(boolean executed)
        Specified by:
        setExecuted in interface PerRequestPaymentData
        Parameters:
        executed - true if related request have been executed, is set after successful processing if a payed call and used to indicate that it cannot be processed again.
